thread.title: Rakitic 'would open door' for Neymar to return to Barca

title: Rakitic 'would open door' for Neymar to return to Barca
text: March 11, 2018 / 12:55 AM / in 9 hours Rakitic 'would open door' for Neymar to return to Barca Reuters Staff 2 Min Read MADRID (Reuters) - Barcelona midfielder Ivan Rakitic would welcome back Neymar to the Nou Camp with open arms as rumours continue to swirl that the Brazilian forward regrets his record transfer from the Catalans to Paris St Germain. FILE PHOTO - Soccer Football - Ligue 1 - Paris St Germain vs Olympique de Marseille - Parc des Princes, Paris, France - February 25, 2018 Paris Saint-Germain’s Neymar warms up before the match REUTERS/Stephane Mahe Neymar is recovering from foot surgery in Brazil and missed PSG’s 2-1 defeat by Real Madrid which dumped the French side out of the Champions League on Tuesday, after which Spanish media reported the forward was unsettled in Paris and has told former team mates he wants to return to Barca. “He hasn’t said anything to me, but if it were up to me, I’d open the door up to him right now,” Rakitic told reporters on Saturday after Barca’s 2-0 win at Malaga, which took the Catalans 11 points clear at the top of La Liga. “It’s not just because I have a good relationship with him, but because of the type of player he is. I would always pick Neymar in my team.” Neymar won two league titles, three King’s Cups and the Champions League in four seasons with Barca but swapped the Nou Camp for the Parc des Princes in August when PSG paid his 222-million-euro buy-out clause. Neymar scored 28 goals for PSG before injuring his metatarsal against Olympique Marseille on Feb. 26, although his relationship with his team mates has been heavily scrutinised since a much-publicised dispute with Edinson Cavani over penalty taking duties in September. Reporting by Richard Martin, editing by Ed Osmond
